The Animal class represents the general characteristics and behavior shared by all animals that exist in the valley.

Creates a new Animal with full energy (100) and zero days.

E

eat() - Method in class domain.Animal

Grass - Class in domain
The Grass class represents grass in the valley, serving as a food source for herbivores like sheep.

Hay - Class in domain
The Hay class represents a hay package located inside the valley.

Creates a new Hay unit in the given position inside the valley.

Main method that starts the program and displays the GUI window.
Mammal - Class in domain
The Mammal class defines the common structure and behavior for all mammals that exist in the valley, such as wolves or sheep.
Mammal(Valley, int, int) - Constructor for class domain.Mammal
Creates a new mammal in the specified valley and position.
move(int, int) - Method in class domain.Mammal
Moves the mammal to a new position inside the valley if the destination is within bounds and empty.

SheepLotVol - Class in domain
The SheepLotVol class represents a sheep following the Lotka-Volterra model.
SheepLotVol(Valley, int, int) - Constructor for class domain.SheepLotVol
Creates a new SheepLotVol in the specified valley and position.
SheepLotVol(Valley, int, int, boolean) - Constructor for class domain.SheepLotVol
Creates a new SheepLotVol that won't act this turn (newborn).

T

ticTac() - Method in class domain.Valley
Executes one simulation step ("Tic-tac") across the entire valley.

U

Unit - Interface in domain
The Unit interface defines the basic behavior and properties of all elements that can exist inside the valley, such as animals or resources.

V

Valley - Class in domain
The Valley class represents the simulation environment where all units (animals and resources) live and interact.
Valley() - Constructor for class domain.Valley
Constructs a new Valley with a fixed size and initializes all positions as empty.
ValleyGUI - Class in presentation
The ValleyGUI class represents the main graphical user interface (GUI) for the valley simulation.

Creates a new WolfLotVol in the specified valley and position.
